availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Francis Bloodgood (Milwaukee, Wisconsin, attorney and commissioner of deeds)

body.p: Milwaukee, Wisconsin, attorney and commissioner of deeds. Wisconsin native. Marries to Josephine M. Colt Bloodgood. Father of Mariam Bloodgood and Francis Bloodgood, Jr. Attorney in Milwaukee in 1860. Commissioner of deeds for the Commonwealth of Kentucky in Milwaukee in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Wisconsin, Milwaukee County, Milwaukee, p. 211; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Wisconsin, Milwaukee County, Milwaukee, Ward 1, p. 149; "Francis Bloodgood Dead," The Sheboygan Press (Sheboygan, Wis.), April 10, 1917, p. 8; Find A Grave, "Francis Bloodgood (1827-1917)," Memorial #90796060, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=90796060&ref=acom (accessed May 9, 2017); KYR-0001-007-0391.
